text: the grateful crane
once upon a time near a pretty little
pond there lived a beautiful crane he
was the most handsome bird there but he
wasn't very grateful for it he hated his
legs his wings his beak and simply
whined about it all year everyone had
heard him grumble from the birds that
lived in the highest tree to the fish
that swam in the deepest part of the
plain they were all very tired of
hearing him one night as he was resting
on a tree he started to grumble as usual
oh these legs of - are useless and these
wings they aren't strong at all neither
are they pretty if only I could have had
wings of colorful of the butterfly oh oh
you scared me oh my heart beats so fast
such a useless heart as well oh what a
funny thing to say no one has a useless
heart then I am no one for everything I
have is useless my legs are like little
twigs might be keys long and ugly and my
wings so pale and white no color at all
how I wish me with a butterfly little
crane shake carefully do you really
think being a butterfly would be better

everyone in the whole world would love
and adore me I would be the most
beautiful creature ever
I wish I could be I warned your little
crane but I speak the truth and tell no
lie by morning you shall be a butterfly
the next morning the crane woke up but
something was wrong it wasn't near his
pond and neither was he a crane anymore
my what a pretty flower I'd never think
such a big flower in my life what are

I'm a butterfly indeed the crane had

no get away Oh No Oh what do i do fly

terrible it has caused me more trouble
than ever
maybe if I were the fish under water it

Oh with a very strange dream about a

where are my wings I'm a fish and this

the sea is so beautiful and I am so

no one would dare come and harm me and
